SECRET
BATTLE SITUATION - NOON - 6th SEPTEMBER, 1918.
1. WESTERN FRONT.
(a) British Front. Across the SOMME we have reached the line ATHIES, MONS-EN-CHAUSSEE, LE MESNIL, DOINGT, BUSSU, (all inclusive), western edge of TEMPLEUX to the original line west of NURLU.
Otherwise there is no change to report on the British front.
Across the SOMME the French have joined us near ATHIES.
(b) French Front. At all points from the VESLE to the junction with the British Army the French have advanced, and the general line reached by them is as follows :- JONCHERY, (west of RHEIMS), LES VANTAUX, ROMAIN, west of MEURIVAL and MUSCOURT, MAIZY, thence along the AISNE CANAL to east of MISSY, thence north-west by CHIVERS, LAFFAUX, NEUVILLE, COURSON, LANDRICOURT, east of VERNEUILLE, through the FOREST OF COUCY, PIERREMENDE, AUTREVILLE, across the OISE to west of ABBECOURT, MAREST, CREPIGNY, GUIVRY, west of BERLAN COURT, FLAVY, VILLETTE, across the SOMME CANAL to OFFOY-FALVY.
2. ITALIAN AND MACEDONIAN FRONTS.
There is no change in the situation.
General Staff,
War Office, S.W.1.
6th September, 1918.
Issued at 12.55 p.m.
